item.title: Wasim Akram & Sachin Tendulkar Autographs
item.description:
On 3 September 1992, a group of past and present Indian and Pakistani cricketers took part in a day/night exhibition match in Muscat, Oman. Pakistan won an exciting encounter with India chasing under the lights. Inzamam Ul-Haq and Sachin Tendulkar top-scored for both teams respectively. I was lucky enough to obtain the autographs of a number of the legends and future bright lights that night thanks to my dad who was part of the official team of doctors on-duty that day. I met the players in the tunnel as they walked towards their team buses after the match.
[ IMG_2131 ]

item.title: Sachin painting
item.description: Little Sachin... :)
Guard of honour for Sachin Tendulkar from the third tier of the North Stand.
Sachin Tendulkar's lap of honour from the third tier of the North Stand
Panorama of the Wankhede Stadium from the third tier of the Sachin Tendulkar stand during Sachin's lap of honour
Thanks to this man, Vinod Bollini, for getting tickets for the match
View of the ground from the third tier of the Sachin Tendulkar Stand. The teams hadn't arrived yet.
Vinod Bollini taking a panorama of the stadium.
Srinath Perur and Natarajan joined us later for the match.
The teams arrived and started doing a few warm up exercises.
We went to the bottom tier post lunch to watch the match from the ground level. I got a horrible sun burn on my nose from sitting here.
Stuff confisicated during frisking of women at the entrance to the stadium.
Photo of a general flag waving under the setting sun.
Day 3 of the test match - Shivnarine Chanderpaul's crab stance while batting as Pragyan Ojha bowls to him.
A panorama the Wankhede Stadium from the third tier of the Sachin Tendulkar Stand.
A panorama of the Wankhede Stadium from the ground tier of the Sachin Tendulkar Stand.
Vinod Bollini watches Sachin Tendulkar's lap of honour.

item.title: Sachin Tendulkar Farewell Speech - Visual Notes
item.description: I listened to Sachin's wonderful heartwarming farewell speech and created these sketch notes using the Brushes app on my ipad. Visual notes by Lynne Cazaly

item.title: Sachin Tendulkar
item.description: I made this sketch when I was about 13 years old, can not remember exactly.
Today was to be Sachin's last Test innings where he made 74. It's a pity that he did a Jayasuriya and way overstayed his sell-by-date, but still he is and will always be a legend of the game.

item.title: Riots erupt in Porvorim again. This time, after Sachin's dismissal.
item.description: Porvorim residents beat up two wiry youngsters of Afro-origin after Sachin Tendulkar's dismissal before his much fantasized century.

item.title: Thank You Sachin Ramesh Tendulkar
item.description: An era has come to an end.. Thank you Sachin for all those moments and memories you have given us over the past 24 years. We will miss you... Just read that usually Sachin wears a black grip on his bat.But for his last and final 200th match he decided to go for this tricolour grip as he wanted to dedicate his career to the country. Took this photograph while watching TV..!

item.title: To our own Master Blaster ~ SACHIN
item.description: Cricket will miss you

item.title: The Little Master, Sachin Tendulkar
item.description: Indian cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar starts his 200th and final test match today after announcing his retirement. I took this photo of Tendulkar when he last visited New Zealand in 2009 and where he went on to make 160 runs in Hamilton. 1973: Born in Bombay (now Mumbai) on 24 April 1989: Makes Test debut for India against Pakistan, aged 16 1990: Scores first Test century, against England 1998: Scores first double century for Mumbai against Australia 2005: Passes Sunil Gavaskar's record of highest number of Test centuries 2008: Becomes the highest run-scorer in Test cricket, passing West Indies' Brian Lara's mark of 11,953 2010: Becomes the most capped player in Test history 2011: Wins the World Cup with India 2012: Scores his 100th international century in ODI v Bangladesh in March; retires from ODIs in December 2013: Announces retirement from cricket Statistics: www.espncricinfo.com/india/content/player/35320.html

item.title: Bharat Ratna Sachin
item.description: Cut outs of Sachin Tendulkar the greatest Indian Cricketer ever, is being displayed by some West Bengal youth's at a Durga Puja immersion ceremony. Sachin has a huge following in India and is an Iconic figure even in the remotest place of India. Sachin received the highest Indian Civilian award " Bharat Ratna".

item.title: 'संसद की सदस्यता कोई ट्रॉफी नहीं'- जावेद अख्तर
item.description: नई दिल्ली। सचिन तेंदुलकर की राज्‍यसभा में लगातार अनुपस्थिति का मामला गरमाता जा रहा है। इस मसले पर जावेद अख्तर के एक बयान ने नया विवाद खड़ा कर दिया है। सचिन की अनुपस्थिति पर टिप्‍पणी करते हुए अख्तर ने कहा कि संसद की सदस्यता कोई ट्रॉफी नहीं है। सचिन को नियमित रूप से संसद आना चाहिए। अख्तर की इस बात ... wp.me/p3dyci-jY6 #ActressRekh, #JavedAkhtar, #MemberOfParliament, #Rajyasabha, #SachinTendulkar, #Trophy
